t: Psalm 9
A Psalm of Thanksgiving for Godâ€™s Justice.
For the choir director; on Muth-labben. A Psalm of David.
I*pn will give thanks to the Lord*s with all my heart; I*ln will tell of all Your wonders.
I*ln will be glad and exult in You; I*ln will sing praise to Your name, O Most High.
When*ln my enemies turn back, They*ln stumble and perish before You.
For*ln You have maintained my just cause; You*ln have sat on the throne judging righteously.
You*ln have rebuked the nations, You have destroyed the wicked; You*ln have blotted out their name forever and ever.
The*ln enemy has come to an end in perpetual ruins, And*ln You have uprooted the cities; The*ln very memory of them has perished.
But*ln the Lord*s abides forever; He*ln has established His throne for judgment,
And*ln He will judge the world in righteousness; He*ln will execute judgment for the peoples with equity.
The*ln Lord*s also will be a stronghold for the oppressed, A*ln stronghold in times of trouble;
And*ln those who know Your name will put their trust in You, For*ln You, O Lord,*s have not forsaken those who seek You.
Sing*ln praises to the Lord,*s who dwells in Zion; Declare*ln among the peoples His deeds.
For*ln He who requires blood remembers them; He*ln does not forget the cry of the afflicted.
Be*ln gracious to me, O Lord;*s See*ln my affliction from those who hate me, You*ln who lift me up from the gates of death,
That*ln I may tell of all Your praises, That*ln in the gates of the daughter of Zion I*ln may rejoice in Your salvation.
The*ln nations have sunk down in the pit which they have made; In*ln the net which they hid, their own foot has been caught.
The*ln Lord*s has made Himself known; He*ln has executed judgment. In*ln the work of his own hands the wicked is snared. Higgaion Selah.
The*ln wicked will return to Sheol, Even*iln all the nations who forget God.
For*ln the needy will not always be forgotten, Nor*ln the hope of the afflicted perish forever.
Arise,*ln O Lord,*s do not let man prevail; Let*ln the nations be judged before You.
Put*ln them in fear, O Lord;*s Let*ln the nations know that they are but men. Selah.
